abstract: The United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit reversed a ruling that Microsoft must turn over email stored in a data center in Dublin.
snippet: The United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit reversed a ruling that Microsoft must turn over email stored in a data center in Dublin.
lead_paragraph: For the last few years, American technology giants have been embroiled in a power struggle with the United States government over when authorities get to see and use the digital data that the companies collect.

headline.main: Microsoft Wins Appeal on Overseas Data Searches
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Wins Appeal on Overseas Data Search

byline.original: By Nick Wingfield and Cecilia Kang
